doc.field: City of New York Department of Plant and Structures, Bureau of Design notes on the Flushing Bridge
City of New York Department of Plant and Structures, Bureau of Design notes on the Flushing Bridge
Handwritten notes dated 1938-1939 by an employee of the City of New York Department of Plant and Structures Bureau of Design relating to the construction of the Flushing Bridge.
Handwritten notes dated 1938-1939 by an employee of the City of New York Department of Plant and Structures Bureau of Design relating to the construction of the Flushing Bridge.

Handwritten notes by an employee of the City of New York Department of Plant and Structures Bureau of Design relating to the construction of various components of the Flushing Bridge. The notes are comprised of diagrams, dimensions, and financial data, and date from 1938 and 1939.
The Flushing Bridge, which spans the Flushing Channel in the New York City borough of Queens, opened in 1939.
